JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle R Hagen

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 9, 2022 at 08:45 am.

10:22 AM Defendant Danielle R Hagen in court.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared by video for Danielle R Hagen.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 21CT97, 21CT122 & 22CF163.
Attorney Knaak relates on status of files with ADA Seidlitz and believes a global resolution will be set.  Request for pleas before Judge Bitney on all files.  Address and phone number updated in CF file.  Reminder note given in court. 
Plea hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Danielle R Hagen
Current: 1480 Comstock Ave Apt 3A, Cumberland, WI 54829 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: Arbor Place 4076 Kothlow Ave, Menomonie, WI 54751 United States

Status hearing on October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
NOH mailed to Def at 1480 Comstock Avenue, #3A, Cumberland, WI 54829 on 10/10/22

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Danielle R Hagen
Current: Arbor Place 4076 Kothlow Ave, Menomonie, WI 54751 United States  (Effective: 09-30-2022)
Prior: 1480 Comstock Ave # 3A, Cumberland, WI 54829

12:58 PM  Defendant Danielle R Hagen appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared by video for Danielle R Hagen.  Attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 21CM211, 21CT97, 21CT122, 22CF121, 22CF163 & 22CM155.
Competency hearings.  Court relates on the report received and that Defendant is competent.  Atotrney Knaak relates defendant agrees she is competent.  Court relates and finds Defendant competent on all files.  Court asks Attorney Knaak about setting the next hearings before Judge Bitney and Judge Boyle.  Attorney Knaak requests that the JA's contact him for scheduling. Court relates NOH's to be sent to the Defendant at the address updated today where she will be until 10/25/2022.  Defendant does not have a cell phone to provide.
and cover sheet for confidential records.

11:32 AM Defendant Danielle R Hagen in court.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared by video for Danielle R Hagen.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

COVERS 21CM211, 21CT97, 21CT122, 22CF121 & 22CF163

State relates.  Attorney Knaak relates. Court relates. 
State requests competency order be modified from outpatient to inpatient. Attorney Knaak objects. 
Court orders Defendant be transported to a forensic unit for inpatient treatment.  
State to prepare order.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

4:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Danielle R Hagen appeared by video. Defendant appears in custody from Rusk County. Attorney Andrew Knaak attorney for Danielle R. Hagen appeared by video.
Attorney Knaak indicates he will be representing the defendant on this case.
Bond modification requested by Attorney Knaak to lower the cash bond to not more than $200.00 cash.
Argument by Attorney Seidlitz. 
Argument by Attorney Knaak.
Court relates and grants bond modification to $250.00.
Court finds the defendant is incompetent, but can be restored to competency with treatment.
This case is suspended pending further order of the court.

Bond and Minute Sheet scanned to Barron County Jail as defendant is being returned to Barron County.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

10:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Danielle R Hagen appeared by video, in custody from Rusk Co Jail.  Attorney Andrew Knaak  appeared by video for Danielle R Hagen. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives further reading of the same.  Defendant qualifies for Public Defender services.
Atty. Knaak will represent.
New date set; Atty. Knaak may appear by zoom video; Danielle may appear by zoom video if she's still in custody.

(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
Status hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
